definition: charges or facts about a crime/the nature of the offense

sentences.english: All three crimes carry a maximum 10-year prison penalty.
sentences.chinese: 三种罪状每种最高可判10年监禁。
他们列举了他的被指称的罪状。

sentences.english: Teach sin the carriage of a holy saint;
sentences.chinese: 哪一个笨贼夸耀他自己的罪状？

sentences.english: Her reputation is sullied by crimes.
sentences.chinese: ta白勺名誉被许多罪状所玷污。

sentences.english: When will was dizzy, will her guilt seeing again.
sentences.chinese: 每次意志晕头晕脑时，将她的罪状再看一遍。

sentences.english: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.
sentences.chinese: 你按罪状刑罚我，又使我担当幼年的罪孽。

sentences.english: The final Ming Tai or only admitted everything counts, let a 'mirror.
sentences.chinese: 最终明台还是只能承认了一切罪状，让明镜一时气结。

sentences.english: And, when he mentioned his reflection on the facts of his crime, he was actually revealing and rebuking the calumniators .
sentences.chinese: 说到他对罪状的反思，实际是对诬陷者的揭落与斥责。

sentences.english: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
sentences.chinese: 在上面有他的罪状，写的是犹太人的王。

sentences.english: The same was true of the second count.
sentences.chinese: 这同样适合第二项罪状。

sentences.english: There are different comprehensions about article 306 of Criminal Law in practice.
sentences.chinese: 实践中，人们对刑法第306条罪状有着不同的理解。

definition: bad record (esp. of a public official)/unsavory track record
to frame sb/to cook up imaginary charges against sb
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
